theJudgeTextsList.author: Author: Mitchell Wintrow
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_title: Chapter 1: The judge and the auras
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p1: Judge Raymond Elisando sat confidently and intently in his seat within the courtroom. The prosecution is pitching their closing statement at the moment, but Raymond doesnâ€™t really need either the prosecutor or the defense attorney to know whether or not the defendant is guilty. No, because he has a secret, and this secret has been helping him move up the ranks quickly in his career.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p2: What is this secret? Well, you see, Judge Elisando happens to be able to see auras around people, particularly the people relying on his verdict and judgment on sentencing. To him, itâ€™s abundantly clear when someone is guilty or innocent. When a defendant is truly innocent, thereâ€™s always a bright, constant, clear shine around them. Itâ€™s almost as if there is a bright white light shining directly onto the defendant, and they are in ultra-high definition, whereas everything else is just standard definition. Kind of like when a camera focuses on something or someone, and the background isnâ€™t quite as clear.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p3: Now, when a defendant is actually guilty of whatever they have been charged with, there seems to be a strange distorting kind of shimmer surrounding the person. Itâ€™s almost as if all around the defendant there is a huge heat source causing the air around them to be heated up so much as to produce the distorting heat waves you might see rising off of the hot asphalt in an Arizona summer.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p4: Even though this is the case and he has this special ability, he still goes along with the usual show, because if he were to share this strange little secret, people would think he is crazy! They would surely throw him out of his position and maybe even send him to a mental institution. Seeing as how his career has been taking off quickly, it seems like heâ€™s made the right decision in both using this unusual ability and keeping it a closely guarded secret. Now heâ€™s sitting here in the courtroom once again, waiting for â€œthe showâ€ to finish so he can deliver the judgment he already knows heâ€™ll make.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p5: â€œSo, given the evidence weâ€™ve provided, your honor, we believe the defendant is not only guilty of possession of a controlled substance, but also guilty of having the intent to sell and distribute it, based on the amounts they were found to have in their possession. I have no further comments to make, your honor, I believe the evidence clearly speaks for itself. Thank you.â€, says the prosecutor, Mr. Eddie Thompson, as he walks back to his side and sits down. Eddie gathers up all of the documents lying on the table, taps them on the table to line them all up and then puts them back into his briefcase.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p6: The defense lawyer, Mr. Victor Broughton, stands up, approaches Judge Elisando, and begins to say his closing remarks, but Raymond is looking directly at the shifting, distorted aura shimmering around the defendant. `Sorry Victor, but this guy is guilty as can be. It doesnâ€™t really matter what closing remarks you have to say, because I definitely see jail time in the defendantâ€™s future.`, Raymond thinks while looking intently at the defendant, or rather at the aura emanating from the defendant like waves of heat from a stove.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p7: â€œ... and thatâ€™s why we ask that you consider the entirety of the circumstances surrounding this case, your honor. Yes, my client has had a troubled past and clearly has a substance abuse problem, but he is by no means a drug dealer or distributor. Thank you.â€, finishes Victor, walking back to his side and taking a seat with a confident look on his face. The defendant leans over to talk with Victor, and there is some whispering, and the defendant nods his head and mouths â€˜Thank you so much.â€™
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p8: Finally, the show is about to  be concluded, but there is one more act left to play. Itâ€™s Raymondâ€™s turn to put on his acting face now. He has to at least make it look like heâ€™s actually considering all of the information that the prosecution and defense has just provided. Otherwise, people might start to catch on that his mind was already made up the moment the defendant walked in the door, and who would trust that judgment? That would reek of bias and prejudice to everyone, and admittedly Raymond completely understands and would feel this way too if he were in their shoes and didnâ€™t know about his ability. Hence the need to put on a good show for the people.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p9: Judge Elisando sat there, wearing his most convincing look of contemplation on his face, with his elbows on the table and his fingers slowly tapping together. Sometimes, this is the hardest part of the job. Not making the actual judgments, thatâ€™s actually the easy part thanks to his uncanny ability to see these auras, but finding a convincing way to explain why he is making this particular judgment, thatâ€™s the hard part. He can only use what information has been presented to him as his reasons, and lately, this has become even more difficult given his quick rise through the ranks and taking on more difficult cases.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p10: Nonetheless, he delivered his verdict after acting out much internal deliberation. â€œBased on all of the evidence provided, I find the defendant guilty of all charges,â€ Raymond said in his most confident and authoritative voice. Immediately, surprised murmuring can be heard throughout the courtroom, and naturally, a shocked and hurt look on the defendantâ€™s face can be seen. Victor happened to look shocked as well, but also a bit concerned, hadnâ€™t he presented a convincing case for his client not to be convicted of the intent to distribute illegal substances?
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p11: â€œOrder, order, please, order in the courtroom. Now, although I find the defendant guilty of all charges, let the record show that I will take into consideration all of the defenseâ€™s remarks when determining the sentencing for these charges.â€ This soothed the murmuring in the courtroom, but only a little. Despite this less than agreeable response from the courtroom, Judge Elisando stood and left the courtroom, heading back to his office.

It felt like chaos, and immediately Ray began to feel a bead of sweat rolling down the side of his face as he remembered the nightmare. Wiping away the sweat, he listened for a clear question which he was able to answer.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p27: â€œJudge Elisando, can you please tell us whether or not youâ€™ve ever presided over a murder case like this before, and why youâ€™re the judge who has been deemed qualified to preside over this particular case?â€ a reporter in the middle of the crowd shouted. Raymond cleared his throat to signal the reporters to be quiet so he could answer, and then responded by saying, â€œFirst, Iâ€™d like to say that I have presided over hundreds of cases during my career, including cases involving manslaughter, murder, burglary, and many other charges. Each case is unique, despite circumstances sometimes seeming similar to other cases, so in that respect, no, I have never presided over a murder case like this before. I am, however, indeed qualified to preside over this case and I have no doubts that I will make a lawful decision based objectively on all of the evidence provided, and I will take into consideration the decision of the jury. The Governor is aware of the publicity and high-profile nature of this case, and he himself decided I would be the one to preside over this case. I trust his decision, and I trust my judgments.â€ â€œThank you Judge Elisando!â€ the reporter said, while jotting down notes onto his iPad.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p28: The reporters again began to shout over one another as they asked all different kinds of questions. After responding to the first question, however, Ray felt much more confident and he answered questions for the remaining time without any issue.  `Hah, and to think I was fretting about this meeting as if it would happen as it had in my dream. That actually went surprisingly well. Maybe tonight Iâ€™ll finally get some good sleep again`, he thought. Soon, he was heading home and finally feeling good about moving forward with this caseâ€¦
